edu.mines.jtk.sgl
Class Matrix44

java.lang.Object
  edu.mines.jtk.sgl.Matrix44

public class Matrix44
extends java.lang.Object

A 4-by-4 matrix.

Version:
2005.05.20
Author:
Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines

Field Summary
 double[] m
          The matrix elements stored contiguously in an array, as in OpenGL.

Field Detail

m

public double[] m
The matrix elements stored contiguously in an array, as in OpenGL. The matrix elements are: 

 | m00  m01  m02  m03 |     | m[ 0]  m[ 4]  m[ 8]  m[12] |
 | m10  m11  m12  m13 |  =  | m[ 1]  m[ 5]  m[ 9]  m[13] |
 | m20  m21  m22  m23 |     | m[ 2]  m[ 6]  m[10]  m[14] |
 | m30  m31  m32  m03 |     | m[ 3]  m[ 7]  m[11]  m[15] |

Constructor Detail

Matrix44

public Matrix44()
Constructs an identity matrix.

Matrix44

public Matrix44(double m00,
                double m01,
                double m02,
                double m03,

                double m22,
                double m23,
                double m30,
                double m31,
                double m32,
                double m33)
Constructs a matrix with specified elements.

Parameters:
m00 - the element with (row,col) indices (0,0)
m01 - the element with (row,col) indices (0,1)
m02 - the element with (row,col) indices (0,2)
m03 - the element with (row,col) indices (0,3)
m10 - the element with (row,col) indices (1,0)
m11 - the element with (row,col) indices (1,1)
m12 - the element with (row,col) indices (1,2)
m13 - the element with (row,col) indices (1,3)
m20 - the element with (row,col) indices (2,0)
m21 - the element with (row,col) indices (2,1)
m22 - the element with (row,col) indices (2,2)
m23 - the element with (row,col) indices (2,3)
m30 - the element with (row,col) indices (3,0)
m31 - the element with (row,col) indices (3,1)
m32 - the element with (row,col) indices (3,2)
m33 - the element with (row,col) indices (3,3)

Matrix44

public Matrix44(double[] m)
Constructs a matrix with specified elements. The specified array of elements is referenced by (not copied into) the constructed matrix. Therefore, any changes to the matrix will be reflected in changes to the elements of the specified array.

Parameters:
m - the array[16] of matrix elements.

Matrix44

public Matrix44(Matrix44 m)
Constructs a copy of the specified matrix.

Parameters:
m - the matrix.

times

public Point3 times(Point3 p)
Returns the product Mp of this matrix M and a point p. The coordinate w of the specified point is assumed to equal 1.0; and the returned point is homogenized, that is, scaled such that its coordinate w equals 1.0.

Parameters:
p - the point p.
Returns:
the product Mp.

times

public Point4 times(Point4 p)
Returns the product Mp of this matrix M and a point p.

Parameters:
p - the point p.
Returns:
the product Mp.

transposeTimes

public Point3 transposeTimes(Point3 p)
Returns the product M'p of the transpose of this matrix M and a point p. The coordinate w of the specified point is assumed to equal 1.0; and the returned point is homogenized, that is, scaled such that its coordinate w equals 1.0.

Parameters:
p - the point p.
Returns:
the product M'p.

transposeTimes

public Point4 transposeTimes(Point4 p)
Returns the product M'p of the transpose of this matrix M and a point p.

Parameters:
p - the point p.
Returns:
the product M'p.

times

public Vector3 times(Vector3 v)
Returns the product Mv of this matrix M and a vector v. Uses only the upper-left 3-by-3 elements of this matrix.

Parameters:
v - the vector v.
Returns:
the product Mv.

transposeTimes

public Vector3 transposeTimes(Vector3 v)
Returns the product M'v of the transpose of this matrix M and a vector v. Uses only the upper-left 3-by-3 elements of this matrix.

Parameters:
v - the vector v.
Returns:
the product M'v.

rotate

public static Matrix44 rotate(double ra,
                              double rx,
                              double ry,
                              double rz)
Returns a new rotation matrix. The rotation is about a specified vector axis.

Parameters:
ra - the angle of rotation, in degrees.
rx - the x component of the vector axis of rotation
ry - the y component of the vector axis of rotation
rz - the z component of the vector axis of rotation
Returns:
the rotation matrix.

ortho

public static Matrix44 ortho(double left,
                             double right,
                             double bottom,
                             double top,
                             double znear,
                             double zfar)
Returns a new orthographic-projection matrix. Parameters correspond to those for the OpenGL standard function glOrtho.

Parameters:
left - the coordinate for the left clipping plane.
right - the coordinate for the right clipping plane.
bottom - the coordinate for the bottom clipping plane.
top - the coordinate for the top clipping plane.
znear - the distance to the near depth clipping plane
zfar - the distance to the far depth clipping plane
Returns:
the orthographic-projection matrix.

frustum

public static Matrix44 frustum(double left,
                               double right,
                               double bottom,
                               double top,
                               double znear,
                               double zfar)
Returns a new perspective-projection matrix. Parameters correspond to those for the OpenGL standard function glFrustum.

Parameters:
left - the coordinate for the left clipping plane.
right - the coordinate for the right clipping plane.
bottom - the coordinate for the bottom clipping plane.
top - the coordinate for the top clipping plane.
znear - the distance to the near depth clipping plane
zfar - the distance to the far depth clipping plane
Returns:
the perspective-projection matrix.

perspective

public static Matrix44 perspective(double fovy,
                                   double aspect,
                                   double znear,
                                   double zfar)
Returns a new perspective-projection matrix. Parameters correspond to those for the OpenGL standard function gluPerspective.

Parameters:
fovy - the field of view, in degrees, in the vertical direction.
aspect - the aspect ratio width/height.
znear - the distance to the near depth clipping plane
zfar - the distance to the far depth clipping plane
Returns:
this perspective-projection matrix.
